channel.title: CNC on Geoffrey Tuttle
channel.description: Recent content in CNC on Geoffrey Tuttle

item.title: MPCNC - Printing and X-Y Assembly
item.description: When I last posted, I had just begun printing the pieces for the Mostly Printed CNC machine. Now, about 120 machine hours and several hours of assembly later, it’s time for an update! Printing and Reprinting Each part was printed at 55% infill, with 3 perimeters, and at 55mm/s. That was a little fast, and resulted in some ringing in the print features, but the parts didn’t need to be pretty, just accurate and functional.

item.title: Mostly Printed CNC Build - Intro
item.description: Over the next month or two, I will build the Mostly Printed CNC (MPCNC), as found on the website v1engineering.com. It is a CNC platform that can be assembled out of inexpensive electronics and hardware, EMT conduit, and 3d printed components. Here is a link to the project specifications and build instructions. This machine can be much more than a typical milling machine: pen plotters, needle cutters, drag knifes, even laser cutting and engraving!
